page.title: 13Droitwich - Law and Order
page.content: The West Mercia Force was formed in 1967 - amalgamation of the Hereford, Shropshire and Worcester police forces. It is made up of 6 divisions - Kidderminster, Redditch, Worcester, Hereford, Shrewsbury and Telford. Each division is headed by a Chief Superintendant. Droitwich is in the Redditch division. In this division there are 261 officers, 200 of which are police constables. There are 18 dogs,9 for detecting bombs, 7 for drugs and 2 for anything buried. In Droitwich there is 1 detective sergeant supported by 3 constables. There are 4 policewomen based at the station. The most common crimes in this area for the year ending 31/12/84 are thefts (1639 reported -437 solved) 1365 thefts form motor vehicles were reported -339 solved.1264 house burglaries were reported -477 solved.
